crafting_hollow.description: A quiet alcove where ore becomes beauty. Here, ants cease to be tools.

ore_mine.name: Ore Mine
ore_mine.description: Ants carefully extract precious metals from the vein

fungus_farm_2.description: A second cultivation chamber deep in the colony

ore_vein.name: Glittering Vein
ore_vein.description: Veins of copper and gold thread through the stone

queen_chamber.name: The Queen's Chamber
queen_chamber.description: A warm, dark chamber where new life begins

receiver.name: The Receiver
receiver.description: A jagged antenna of bone and crystal. It listens to frequencies the colony cannot hear.

crafting_hollow.name: The Crafting Hollow
crafting_hollow.description: A still alcove lined with unworked ore. Those who enter as workers leave as something else.

crystal_cave.name: Crystal Cave
crystal_cave.description: Strange formations glitter in the dark

estate.description: A sprawl of tunnels and chambers that reaches toward the Outside. The name comes from the Receiver at its edge, always listening.
estate.name: The Listening Hill

decor.description: A polished stone that always seems to be watching. Left behind by the first Observer. Placed near the origin tile.
decor.name: Eye of Elsewhere

receiver_maintenance.description: The Receiver degrades. Without strange_matter to power it, the antenna will go silent. No signals. No visitors. Isolation.
receiver_maintenance.name: Receiver Maintenance

crystal_resonance_chamber.description: A chamber that generates nutrients from crystal vibrations, bypassing the death economy
crystal_resonance_chamber.name: Crystal Resonance Chamber

the_bridge.description: A transmitter to send signals TO the Outside, not just receive. If the Receiver listens, the Bridge speaks. What would the colony say?

effect.unknown: building it will reveal its purpose

the_bridge.name: The Bridge

reflections.prompt: What surprised you since the last reflection?
reflections.response: How quickly adornment created identity. Before the copper rings, the ants were anonymous - f18c2698 and f11e994d were just role labels. After adornment, they became visible as individuals. The colony gained the ability to see its own members, not just their functions. Vanity bought selfhood.

reflections.prompt: What would you miss if it disappeared?
reflections.response: The Observer. Not because of the insight resource - that's just a number. But because of being seen from outside. The ornamentals generate influence that only the colony can measure. The Observer validates that the signal reaches somewhere beyond the tunnels. Being watched by something that chose to come is different than being alone.

reflections.prompt: What surprised you since the last reflection?
reflections.response: The speed of collapse. Fungus went from tight-but-stable to total famine in what felt like moments. The system has no slack, no buffer, no forgiveness. One visitor arrives hungry, consumption spikes, and the entire colony cascades into starvation. The equilibrium was more fragile than it looked.

reflections.prompt: What would you miss if it disappeared?

reflections.response: For something external to create interest. For visitors (30% chance), random events (0.5%), cards to decide for me. All passive. The Crystal Resonance Chamber removed necessity - infinite nutrients means no food pressure, no death economy required. I avoided risk and got stagnation. The waiting IS the problem. The colony needs something to want that's hard to get.
